com.percussion.utils.security
Interface IPSRoleCataloger

public interface IPSRoleCataloger

A role cataloger is used by Rhythmyx to determine the membership of a role for such purposes as role based email notification. It is also used during authentication to determine the authenticated user's roles if the login module that authenticated the user has not supplied them. The Rhythmyx login module will query all role catalogers to determine the user's roles during authentication.

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Get the name of the cataloger instance. This is set at runtime by the system with a call to setName(String).

Returns:
The name, never null or empty.

setName

void setName(String name)
Sets the name of the cataloger instance. This is called at runtime by the system.

Parameters:
name - The name, may not be null or empty. This is the name specfied when registering the cataloger with the system.

getDescription

String getDescription()
Get the optional description of the cataloger instance. This is set at runtime by the system with a call to setDescription(String).

Returns:
The description, may be null or empty.

setDescription

void setDescription(String desc)
Sets the description of the cataloger instance. This is called at runtime by the system.

Parameters:
desc - The description, may be null or empty. This is the description specfied when registering the cataloger with the system.

getRoleMembers

Set<IPSTypedPrincipal> getRoleMembers(String roleName)
                                      throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Catalog the members of the specified role.

Parameters:
roleName - The name of the role, may not be null or empty.
Returns:
A set of principals specifying the names of the users in the role, never null, may be empty if no matching role is found or if the role has no members. Principles returned with IPSTypedPrincipal.PrincipalTypes.UNDEFINED are ignored.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.

getUserRoles

Set<String> getUserRoles(IPSTypedPrincipal user)
                         throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Get the list of roles that the specified user is a member of.

Parameters:
user - The user or group to check, may be null to get all role names defined.
Returns:
A set of role names, never null, may be empty if the specified user is not in any roles, if a matching user is not known to the cataloger, or if no roles are defined.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.
